intro: Waltheria matogrossensis, commonly known as the Matogrossense spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, tropical environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
